alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:21PM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding will soon occur and major flooding is forecast by Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM PDT Friday was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.2 feet on 05/29/1948. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon or as updates become available.Saturday evening at 630 PM PDT.
